metadata.description: Name of data factory service. If empty, name will be generated.
AAD client application id for accessing FHIR server
Audience (resource) of the FHIR API app registration
Size of VMs in Azure Batch
HTTP location of custom artifacts (activities), etc.

typeProperties.connectionString: [concat('Data Source=tcp:', reference(resourceId('Microsoft.Sql/servers/', variables('sqlserverName'))).fullyQualifiedDomainName, ',1433;Initial Catalog=', variables('sqlDatabaseName'), ';User Id=', parameters('sqlServerAdminUserName'), '@', variables('sqlServerName'), ';Password=', parameters('sqlServerAdminPassword'), ';')]

sink.preCopyScript:
DROP TABLE [dbo].[Patients];

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Patients](
	[id] [varchar](50) NOT NULL,
	[gender] [varchar](50) NULL,
	[birthDate] [datetime] NULL,
	[multipleBirth] [varchar](50) NULL,
	[lastUpdated] [datetime] NULL,
	[maritalStatus] [varchar](50) NULL,
	[lattitude] [float] NULL,
	[longitude] [float] NULL
) ON [PRIMARY];

source.sqlReaderQuery:
DECLARE @LatestWeight table 
( 
   id varchar(50), 
   subject varchar(50), 
   weight float 
)

DECLARE @LatestHeight table 
( 
   id varchar(50), 
   subject varchar(50), 
   height float 
)

;WITH w AS
(
   SELECT *,
         ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY subject ORDER BY issued DESC) AS rn
   FROM Weight
)
INSERT INTO @LatestWeight 
SELECT w.id, w.subject, w.weight
FROM w
WHERE rn = 1

;WITH h AS
(
   SELECT *,
         ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY subject ORDER BY issued DESC) AS rn
   FROM Height
)
INSERT INTO @LatestHeight 
SELECT h.id, h.subject, h.height
FROM h
WHERE rn = 1

SELECT Patients.id AS patientId, DATEDIFF(hour, Patients.birthDate, GETDATE())/8766 AS ageYears, Patients.lattitude, Patients.longitude, [@LatestWeight].weight, [@LatestHeight].height  FROM Patients
INNER JOIN @LatestHeight ON [@LatestHeight].subject LIKE '%'+Patients.id+'%' 
INNER JOIN @LatestWeight ON [@LatestWeight].subject LIKE '%'+Patients.id+'%'
